title: At its best, AI can help us to reflect on our humanity. At its worst, it can lead us to forget it
content: Almost all conversations around AI come down to these hopes and fears: that at its best AI can help us to reflect on our humanity. At its worst, it can lead us to forget it — or subjugate it. When AI is dismissed as flawed, it is often through a concern that it will make us less human — or redundant. The problem with this approach is that it can overlook the very real problems, and risks, in being human. title: No, the explainer isn’t dead. It just needs a reason to live.
content: Marie Gilot says the explainer is dead.
